title: 5 Ways Tech Companies Can Improve Their Sustainability - Entrepreneur
summary: The tech industry is increasingly focusing on sustainable practices. This article outlines five strategies tech companies are using to reduce their environmental impact, including embracing the circular economy, investing in eco-friendly products and manufacturing, encouraging recycling, extending the lifecycle of devices, and fostering a culture of sustainability.

title: Strengthening Sustainable Building Operations | BCG - BCG
summary: The building sector is a major contributor to greenhouse gas emissions. Achieving net-zero emissions will require collaboration between asset owners, OEMs, utility companies, and local regulators. These stakeholders can leverage energy efficiency and fuel switching/electrification to decarbonize building operations, with opportunities for cost savings, new business lines, and stronger reputations.

title: Is the Skincare Industry Recession Proof? - Happi
summary: A survey of 1,500 Americans reveals skincare sales are rebounding despite inflation, with consumers prioritizing quality over price.  Millennials in the Northeast are the most likely to purchase skincare, especially those in affluent households. Skincare brands should focus on loyalty, emphasizing quality and everyday luxury, as well as highlighting DEI and sustainability initiatives to appeal to value-conscious consumers.

title: Sustainable Technology Solutions: How Tech Giants Have Adopted Green Initiatives - ABP Live
summary: The tech industry is increasingly embracing sustainable technologies, driven by environmental concerns, regulatory pressure, consumer demand, cost savings, and innovation. Companies like Apple, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, Intel, Dell, Salesforce, and HP are implementing green initiatives, such as using renewable energy, reducing waste, and promoting responsible recycling. This not only benefits the environment but also contributes to a more positive societal impact by influencing consumer behavior and inspiring other industries.

title: MT Interview: Stuart Mustoe, CEO TrustFord - Motor Trader
summary: TrustFord, a Ford dealership group, is expanding its presence in northern England and Scotland with new dealerships opening in Carlisle, Aberdeen, and Glasgow. The company is focused on sustainability and has set a goal to be carbon neutral by 2035. They are also embracing the shift towards electric vehicles, with plans to offer a range of EV models and training for staff in EV technologies.
